sub_title: SRHR & Gender | Development | Young Leader Alum @Women Deliver | Globalshaper @WEF
summary:
Tasneem Kakal is a feminist advocate and researcher in development, currently working at Royal Tropical Institute (KIT), Amsterdam. She works at the intersection of gender and health across Africa and Asia- with a focus on sexual and reproductive health and rights (SRHR), gender, youth and sexuality, and population and development. She has experience in grassroots initiatives in her hometown Mumbai, India where she co-founded two youth-led organisations working in rural areas and urban slums. She has worked at different levels and stakeholders with communities, governments and international organisations. Prior to KIT, she worked with Jameel Poverty Action Lab (J-PAL) and Oxfam Novib. She is an alumnus of the Institute of Social Studies in the Hague, a Global Shaper at the World Economic Forum, a World Youth Service Enterprise (WYSE) Alumni, an member of the Asia Europe Foundation University Alumni Network (ASEFUAN) and a Young Leader alum @Women Deliver.
You can see an updated list of publications here: https://www.kit.nl/staff/tasneem-kakal/

profile_positions.title: Young Leader

profile_positions.description:
The Global Shapers Community is a network of local groups led by young people who are exceptional in their potential, achievements and drive to make a positive contribution to their communities. The Global Shapers Community provides young people with a global platform to shape the future, integrating the personal, community and global dimension.
See @GlobalShapersNL or twitter.com/GlobalShapersNL for more information.
profile_positions.title: World Economic Forum Global Shaper

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for Conceptualisation, Planning and Executing the project.
Coordinated the Fundraising, Operations and Logistics along with Volunteer and Donor management
Creating Impact Assessment Reports and Managing Public Relations
Responsible for Design & Branding (included brochures, posters etc.)

The Campus Bicycle Project is a not-for-profit started by young people which aims at using the bicycle as an instrument to reduce drop-out rates and increase productivity for students who walk long distances to school in rural areas.

Contact: campusbicycleproject@gmail.com
profile_positions.title: Co-founder

profile_positions.description:
Support the incubation and building of Oxfam Novib's new platform- Oxfam Novib Academy, a platform for Oxfam Novib to engage and co-create practice-oriented research with students and universities in the Netherlands
Responsible for strategy, coordination and implementation 
Responsible for partnership development with universities, recruitment of interns and project management 

The tasks are carried out as an AMID trainee through a post-master programme in conjunction with Radboud University, Nijmegen

Contact: tasneem.kakal@oxfamnovib.nl
profile_positions.title: Project Officer

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for co-ordinating the local community programmes of Platform Spartak in The Hague 
Develop and implement the Membership Strategy 
Volunteer management

Platform Spartak is an inter-disciplinary learning platform for young people that aims to strengthen bonds between Eastern and Western Europe.

Contact: tasneem@platformspartak.eu
profile_positions.title: Board Member- Community Programmes

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for conceptualising, planning and executing the project. 
Coordinated the fundraising and public relation activities, operations and resource management.

Jal Jyoti is a social venture that aims to light up homes using a PET bottle of water, bleach and sunlight to create bottle-lights which are installed in slum homes that lack access to natural light and cannot afford electricity. We garnered the the Mother Teresa International Certificate of Appreciation for Social Justice and the Wal-Mart Women’s Empowerment Grant.
Find out more at http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LdgO_Z8M34M

Contact: tasneem@jaljyoti.org
